text: On January 10, 2025, CNC-01 experienced spindle vibration caused by worn bearings. Bearings were replaced and alignment was recalibrated. Downtime was 60 minutes.
On January 11, 2025, CNC-02 overheated due to restricted coolant flow. The coolant filter was replaced, restoring normal temperature. Downtime was 40 minutes.
On January 12, 2025, CNC-03 stopped unexpectedly because of a faulty proximity sensor. The sensor was replaced and tested. Downtime was 30 minutes.
On January 13, 2025, CNC-04 showed axis misalignment caused by loose mounting bolts. Bolts were tightened and alignment verified. Downtime was 25 minutes.
On January 14, 2025, CNC-05 experienced power fluctuations due to a failing power supply unit. The PSU was replaced. Downtime was 50 minutes.
On January 15, 2025, CNC-06 had lubrication failure caused by an empty oil reservoir. Oil was refilled and flow tested. Downtime was 20 minutes.
On January 16, 2025, CNC-07 generated tool change errors due to debris in the tool magazine. The magazine was cleaned. Downtime was 35 minutes.
On January 17, 2025, CNC-08 experienced overheating from a clogged heat exchanger. The exchanger was flushed. Downtime was 45 minutes.
On January 18, 2025, CNC-09 failed to start due to a corrupted controller configuration. Settings were restored from backup. Downtime was 55 minutes.
On January 19, 2025, CNC-10 showed abnormal noise caused by loose drive belts. Belts were tensioned correctly. Downtime was 30 minutes.
